description.narrative:
Caritas Denmark and CAFOD as well as Secours Catholique signed a memorandum of understanding to enter into a 4-year strategic partnership and this partnership underpins the phase 2 of ENHANCE project, ENHANCE 2 will support Caritas organizations in Myanmar to strengthen their humanitarian response capacity.
CAFOD, Caritas Denmark and Secours Catholique selected KMSS National Office and its 9 dioceses (Myitkyina, Bhamo, Lashio, Kalay, Taung Ngu, Pathein, Loikaw, Ha Kha and Yangon) to support MKSS’s Humanitarian Capacity Building needs which has been identified in 2021 with all partner dioceses and guidance of National Director to enable them to respond more effectively and efficiently to ongoing emergency (both Covid19 and Nation Crisis) and any future emergencies in compliance with international humanitarian principles and standards. Other CIMOs in country such as Caritas Australia, CRS and Trocaire will also provide technical support and funding in some part of needs and gaps.
The project will support KMSS NO and its 9 dioceses to use in practices for the responsibilities of National and Diocesan offices which mentions in KMSS Emergency Response Protocol, effective and timely decision making, delegation and communication flow among director, Program Manager and Senior managers in the selected DOs, to improve practices for information sharing and responsibility of data management, improve using of online platform, capacity building of parish actors as well as to promote community based/led approaches and to equip knowledge of basic humanitarian curriculum to staff in the selected dioceses.
